=== About Ubuntu Utah ===
The UtahTeam advocates the use of Open Source software and Ubuntu Linux in the State of Utah.  This is done through CD Distribution, Team expansion and user-base support.

* <nowiki>[[http://utah.ubuntu-us.org|Ubuntu Utah Website]]</nowiki>
* <nowiki>[[http://www.ubuntulinux.org/community/conduct/|Code of Conduct]]</nowiki>
* <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/UtahTeam/Meetings/|Utah Team Meetings]]</nowiki>

=== Members List ===
* <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/UtahTeam/Members|Utah Team Members List with Nicks]]</nowiki>
* <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/~ubuntu-utah/+members|Members List]]</nowiki>

If you are interested in joining our team please apply on our launchpad page <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/~ubuntu-utah/+members|~ubuntu-utah]]</nowiki>.  All that is required is residency in Utah and a desire to see Ubuntu grow.

=== What We Do ===
* Educate the public about Ubuntu
* Supply Ubuntu (CDs & CD images)
* Support Ubuntu Locally

=== Events ===
* October 2009: <nowiki>[[http://2009.utosc.com|Utah Open Source Conference 2009]]</nowiki>
* Novermber 2009: Ubuntu 9.10 Release Party

== Team Initiatives ==
Community contributions by members of our team:
* Rob Oakes develops and maintains Time Drive, which is an easy to use backup and archiving program.  Because it is uses Duplicity for its backend, it is also compatible with Deja-Dup.  (For more information, see http://blog.oak-tree.us/index.php/science-and-technology/time-drive.)
* Our team also contributes to LyX-Outline, an add-on to the popular LaTeX front-end, LyX.  LyX-Outline provides writers with a way to better visualize and manipulate the structure of their documents.  It is primarily targeted toward academic and creative writers.  (More information can be found on the LyX-Outline project page at http://blog.oak-tree.us/index.php/science-and-technology/lyx-outline.)
